New Records: Shohei Ohtani hit a three-run home run in his first playoff game.
Five Dodgers relievers held the Padres scoreless over the final six innings.
Key Match Events: The Dodgers came back from a 3-0 deficit to win the game.
The Padres took an early 5-3 lead in the third inning.
Pre-Game Insights: Shohei Ohtani was confident and showed no nervousness during the game.
Manager Dave Roberts emphasized the importance of the bullpen's performance.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Dave Roberts highlighted the team's resilience after the comeback win.
Shohei Ohtani felt the intensity of the game and found it exciting.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Jack Flaherty will start for the Dodgers in Game 2.
Yu Darvish will pitch for the Padres and has a strong history against the Dodgers.
